bill_title: reduce the time period for revising fees for full-service restaurant on-sale licenses.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to reduce the time period for revising fees for full-service restaurant on-sale licenses. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 35-4-116 be amended to read as follows: 35-4-116. Any municipality or county adopting the ordinance pursuant to § 35-4-111 may issue additional on-sale licenses to full-service restaurants. Any municipality adopting such ordinance shall charge at least one dollar for each person residing within the municipality as measured determined by the last preceding decennial federal census. Any county adopting such ordinance shall charge at least one dollar for each person residing within the county but outside the boundary of any municipality as measured determined by the last preceding decennial federal census. Each municipality or county shall set the on-sale license fee within ninety days of adopting the ordinance pursuant to § 35-4-111 or within thirty days after the resolution of any appeal pursuant to § 35-4-120. After the fee for an on-sale license issued pursuant to §§ 35-4-110 to 35-4-120, inclusive, has been determined, no municipality or county may change the fee for a period of ten five years unless a growth in population reported by the federal decennial census requires an increase in the fee.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
